title: Bitcoin REVERSAL Begins… How Long Will It Last?
transcript: Bitcoin  just  did  something  on  a  very  low   time  frame  that  it  hasn't  done  for  the   past  several  weeks  since  it  was  trading   above  $90,000.  And  that  means  that   currently  it  is  attempting  to  put  in  a   reversal.  Which  of  course  means  if  it's   successful  that  we  could  see  the  bottom   or  at least  a  local  bottom  being  formed   right  now.  Now,  as  I  told  you,  the  point   of  this  channel  is  now  to  be  as   extremely  objective  as  we  can  each  and   every  day.  And  on  these  market  updates,   we're  going  to  be  giving  you  the  most   important  update,  which  is  of  course  the   price  update,  which  often  reflects  the   most  objective  truth  in  the  markets,   which  is  are  there  buyers  or  are  there   sellers?  And  right  now,  what  we  can  see   is  that  for  the  first  time,  Bitcoin  has   actually  gotten  above  a  prior  15minute   candle  high.  You  can  see  this  uh  the   prior  high  was  about  68,400.   since  about  $90,000.  This  hasn't  really   happened  where  Bitcoin  was  actually   trying  to  make  it  above  these  15-minute   candles  and  then  just  started  dumping,   dumping,  dumping.  And  what  you'll  find   is  that  as  soon  as  a  local  15-minute   high  was  formed,  Bitcoin  pretty  much   hasn't  broken  it  all  the  way  down.  It's   just  lower  and  lower  and  lower.  It  does   not  go  up  on  this  15  candle  time  frame.   And  that's  partly  what's  been  so   incredibly  damning  from  this  Bitcoin   sell-off  is  there's  just  been  a   relentlessness  to  it,  a  relentlessness   to  this  sell-off.  And  as  you  can  see,  we   had  this  huge  cascade,  but  even  as  we   came  up,  we  didn't  get  above  this  prior   15-minute  level.  So,  in  my  opinion,  what   we're  seeing  here  is  actually  pretty   significant  that  we  could  get  above  this   $68,400   level.  Of  course,  I  mentioned  on   yesterday's  live  that  during  these   15-minute  highs  that  are  getting  put  in,   you  can  kind  of  easily  short  knowing   that  your  invalidation  is  very  close.  In   fact,  I  put  it  on  a  short  this  morning   just  as  we  were  tickling  this  level  and   I  put  my  stop  loss  just  above  it  and  it   stopped  out  for  a  fraction  of  a  percent.   And  that's  okay.  That's  okay  to  lose   small  when  your  chance  to  win  was   actually  pretty  significant  because  most   of  these  moves  have  been,  you  know,  4  5%   which  if  you're  using  leverage  can  be   significant  as  far  as  wins.  So,  what   we're  seeing  here  is  that  Bitcoin  needs   to  keep  this  train  rolling.  If  we  are   going  to  see  a  reversal,  we  need  to  see   it  continue  to  take  out  these  little   mini  bosses  before  we  get  to  the  first   very  big  boss,  which  is,  of  course,  this   $72,000  level.  This  was  the  source  of   the  big  breakdown.  And  really,  this   marked  the  bottom  of  that  very   significant  range  that  we  established   from  the  prior  high  when  we  first  had   the  Bitcoin  ETF  go  live  back  in  March  of   2024.  It  also  marked  the  ultimate  low  of   Trump's  initial  tariff  scare  in  the   spring  of  2025.  So  getting  above  this   area  between  72  and  74K,  that  is  by  far   the  biggest  area  to  get  over  before  we   should  really  start  getting  incredibly   bullish.  But  I  wanted  to  point  this  out   because  on  a  low  time  frame,  we've  seen   Bitcoin  finally  finally  break  out  of   this  just  crushing  downward  spiral  that   it's  been  in,  like  I  said,  with  one   cascade  here,  but  it's  been  in  this  all   the  way  up  to  the  $90,000  territory.  So   this  is  a  massive  step  forward,  at least   for  Bitcoin,  bucking  the  initial  trend.   It  doesn't  mean  much  yet  because  I  would   say  that  if  you  zoom  out,  we're  now   probably  going  to  be  in  this  weekly   range  for  a  while.  And  that  could  be   pretty  good  because  what  we've  seen  is   that  in  most  bare  markets,  and  it's   undeniable  at  this  point  that  we're  not   in  a  bare  market.  We  are  definitely  in  a   bare  market,  but  in  most  bare  markets,   there's  usually  significant  rallies  or   bounces  at least  out  of  crypto  assets.   We  usually  see  things  bounce  really   aggressively.  And  in  the  case  of  this   bare  market,  we  have  not  seen  that.  we   have  seen  pretty  much  a  an  orderly   sell-off  from  the  highs.  And  so  if  we   end  up  in  this  new  weekly  range,  which  I   would  say  the  low  right  now  is  60  and   the  high  is  this  prior  wick  support  here   around  80,  that  is  your  range.  And  so  we   might  bounce  around  here,  but  at least   there's  a  chance  here  for  some  serious   bounces  and  serious  rallies.  So  long  as   we  stay  above  this  $60,000  level,  I   would  imagine  that  we  at  least  get  a   little  bit  of  calm  here,  if  not  a  mean   reversion  rally.  And  your  key  to  knowing   if  this  doesn't  hold,  the  first  sign   will  be  falling  below  this  64  $65,000   local  low.  That  would  be  a  sign  that  new   weakness  is  forming.  And  then  of  course   confirming  below  the  $60,000  level.  That   would  mean  we're  seeing  a  whole  another   leg  to  the  bare  market.  And  that  would   be  probably  where  we  start  to  make  our   ways,  I  would  think,  towards  at least   significantly  closer  towards  our   ultimate  lows.  But  within  this  range,   it's  possible  that  we  see  deviations.  Uh   but  I  wouldn't  be  surprised  to  see  us   kind  of  chop  around  here  for  at  least  a   few  weeks,  if  not  a  month  or  two.  That   wouldn't  be  surprising  to  me  at  all   because  we've  seen  so  many  fireworks   from  the  prior  high  of  126,000  all  the   way  down  to  60,000.  That's  over  a  50%   drop  in  just  a  few  weeks.  That  to  me  is   enough  violence  for  now.  But  I  wanted  to   go  over  this  because  there's  actually   other  things  going  on  in  the  markets   today.  But  the  first  day  in  a  long  time,   not  everything  is  blood  red  on  the   dashboard  here.  Bitcoin  with  a  nice   little  bounce.  ETH  back  above  2K.  Soul   doing  okay  back  above  80.  But  really   what  I  want  to  point  out  to  you  is  gold.   Gold  to  me  is  the  most  interesting  chart   here  because  if  we  go  to  our  trade   setups,  you  can  see  that  it's  actually   bouncing  right  near  a  critical  support.   And  you  can  see  here  that  the  gold  chart   is  actually  trying  to  get  above  this   $5,100  level.  And  you  can  see  almost  a   nice  pattern  of  higher  lows  and  higher   highs  being  formed  here.  Obviously,  it   needs  to  get  above  this  5100  before  it   becomes  really  interesting.  But  it's   unclear  to  me  whether  gold  is  just  about   to  roll  over  and  die.  Again,  I'm  flat  on   gold  right  now,  but  I'm  going  to  get   very  interested  if  it's  able  to  get   above  that  $5,100  price  point.  I'm  going   to  be  getting  significant  exposure  cuz   it  looks  like  there's  another  leg  or  at   least  a  retest  of  that  high  on  the  cards   for  the  shiniest  of  all  rocks.  Now,  I   think  we  should  talk  about  something   else,  which  is  that  we  have  evidence   today  of  the  economy  reacelerating.  And   I  think  that  this  is  a  very,  very   important  point  because  that  brings  in   other  trades  into  the  equation.   Remember,  the  point  of  this  channel  is   to  make  the  most  money  possible.  And  as   I've  said  over  the  last  few  episodes,  I   am  interested  obviously  in  buying  the   ultimate  lows  here  in  bare  market  town   in  crypto.  But  I  have  come  to  terms  with   the  fact  that  there  are  a  lot  of  reasons   why  crypto  isn't  pumping  right  now.   There's  a  lot  of  FUD.  There's  a  lot  of   uncertainty.  And  quite  frankly,  there's   a  lot  of  other  sectors  in  the  economy   that  are  pulling  marginal  speculative   dollars  away  from  crypto.  And  to  be  very   clear,  those  are  AI,  robotics,  and  the   energy,  the  bottlenecks  that  are   powering  these  new  emerging  fields.   Those  are  very  very  exciting,  very   interesting.  And  if  you've  been  playing   with  them  at  all,  you'll  know  that  they   are  absolutely  mind-blowing  in  what  they   are  capable  of. Something  that  I  think  crypto  will   eventually  come  to  do,  but  right  now  it   is  struggling  to  do. And  so  why  am   I  telling  you  this?  because  there's  one   trade  that  has  come  into  clear  view  over   the  last  few  days  and  weeks.  Something   I've  been  highlighting  periodically,  but   there's  a  new  data  point  that  actually   supports  this  worldview  and  I  wanted  to   show  it  to  you.  Here's  Fijiao.  He's  uh   if  you  guys  aren't  following  him,  please   do.  Uh  Fhiao  Inc.  He  is  just  an   incredible  macro  analyst  here.  Go  ahead   and  gas  him  up  on  this  tweet  because   he's  essentially  saying  that  the  economy   is  reacelerating.  In  specific,  he's   highlighting  that  there's  been  a   bottoming  and  a  reversal  on  non-farm   payrolls.  And  you  can  see  that  this   downtrend  has  been  in  effect  since  2022.   So  this  is  a  big  change.  It  shows  that   the  end  of  quantitative  tightening  is   also  transitioning  into  a  period  of   expansion.  Now,  as  you  know,  we've  been   talking  about  ISM  on  this  channel  for   quite  a  while,  and  that  finally  broke   above  the  hallowed  50  mark,  which  is  of   course  the  sign  of  an  accelerating   economy.  We  can  see  that  the  recent  uh   monthly  data  output  was  52.6,  which  is  a   huge  uptick  and  a  great  sign  for  those   who  are  looking  for  economic  recovery.   So,  you  combine  these  two  pieces  of   data,  the  non-farm  payrolls  and  the   uptick  in  ISM.  And  Felix  here  did  the   numbers.  You  should  check  out  his   Forward  Guidance  podcast,  but  he  showed   that  copper  miners  are  effectively  when   you  combine  these  two  pieces  of  data,   looking  out  a  12-month  time  period,   copper  miners  are  the  biggest   beneficiaries  of  this  combination  of   data.  Now,  if  you  remember,  we've  been   heavily  looking  at  copper  as  an  asset   over  the  last  few  weeks  and  months   because  copper  is  the  next  best  metal   for  conductivity  in  producing  renewable   energies. You  can  see   here  since  2020,  it's  just  been  kind  of   grinding  up  against  this  uh  sort  of   diagonal  yellow.  And  it  even  broke  out   for  a  second  here.  It  didn't  quite  make   it  out.  But  what  I  actually  like  is   looking  at  large-scale  copper  miners,   copper  producers.  And  what  you'll  see  is   that  this  is  a  prior  high  on  FCX,   Freeport  McMoran,  which  is  a  stock  that   I  do  own  in  pretty  significant  size   here. So,  I'm  still  holding  this   FCX  position. summary_hu: A Bitcoin újra megpróbálja elérni a fordulópontot, mivel sikerült átlépnie egy korábbi 15 perces gyertya magasságát, amely 68,400 dollár körül volt. Az elmúlt hetek eladási nyomásához képest ez jelentős lépés, amit a piaci hangulat is pozitívan tükröz. Az előző maximumok 90,000 dollár körül voltak, és a jövőbeni emelkedés kulcsfontosságú szintje a 72,000 dollár lehet. Jelenleg a Bitcoin a 60,000–80,000 dolláros tartományban mozoghat, amely lehetőséget adhat komolyabb emelkedésekre. Az elemző figyelmeztetett, hogy ha a Bitcoin a 64,000–65,000 dolláros szint alá esik, az újabb gyengeséget jelezhet. Emellett utalt arra is, hogy az AI és robotika területei is érdekes befektetési lehetőségeket kínálnak, amelyek elvonhatják a figyelmet a kriptovalutáktól.
summary_en: Bitcoin is attempting a reversal by breaking above a previous 15-minute candle high at around 68,400 dollars, a significant step compared to the relentless selling pressure seen in recent weeks. With prior highs hovering near 90,000 dollars, a key resistance level for future upward movement is at 72,000 dollars. Currently, Bitcoin is in the 60,000-80,000 dollar range, which could allow for substantial rallies. The analyst cautioned that falling below the 64,000-65,000 dollar mark could signify new weakness. Additionally, he highlighted potential investment opportunities in AI and robotics that might divert funds from cryptocurrencies.
key_points_hu: Bitcoin próbálja elérni a 68,400 dolláros szintet.
A következő nagyobb ellenállási szint 72,000 dollár.
Az AI és robotika érdekes befektetési lehetőségeket kínál.
key_points_en: Bitcoin attempts to break through the 68,400 dollar level.
The next significant resistance point is 72,000 dollars.
AI and robotics present interesting investment opportunities.
main_topics: Investment Opportunities in AI and Robotics
